documents.content: { "schools": [ "Rita Tong Liu School of Business and Hospitality Management", "School of Humanities and Languages", "S.K. Yee School of Health Sciences", "Felizberta Lo Padilla Tong School of Social Sciences" ], "industry_endorsements": [ { "name": "Mr Clement Chan", "title": "Managing Director - Assurance, BDO Limited", "endorsement": "As an advisor to the Rita Tong Liu School of Business and Hospitality Management of Caritas Institute of Higher Education for the last 6 years, I come to know the development and planned scope of the curriculum of the Accountancy Stream of BBA (Hons) programme. I have no reservation to recommend the programme to people who intend to make a career in accounting and finance related fields as it covers well all the current and contemporary skillsets and knowledge one would need to become a proficient starter in those fields." }, { "name": "Dr Eva Chan", "title": "Chairman - Hong Kong Investor Relations Association", "endorsement": "明愛專上學院的工商管理(榮譽)企業管理及管治學士學位課程，獲得香港特許秘書公會(HKICS)認可為「學位課程合作夥伴」(PBP)。學院亦設有兼讀制模式，為在職人士提供獲取特許公司治理專業資格機會。各界別畢業生除了有機會得到HKICS會員資格外，對於課程涵蓋了公司治理及公司秘書服務领域，將為公司在投資領域中擁有高專業和道德標準水平。" }, { "name": "Dr Kevin Lau, JP", "title": "President - Hong Kong Small and Medium Enterprises Development Institute", "endorsement": "有見行內不少設計人士為理想打拼，最終目標是創立屬於自己的品牌。不過，無論創業或內部創新，特別是針對中小型企業，皆要具備商業管理、項目管理、業務策劃等學問，而這正是不少創意人的薄弱之處。明愛專上學院廖湯慧靄商業及款待管理學院與明愛白英奇專業學校設計學系合辦之設計新創企業管理（榮譽）學士課程，為學員提供跨學科訓練，培養他們成為設計創業家。從業員以兼讀形式進修，可於3年內修畢課程。一個獨一無二結合設計新創與企業管理的課程，正好協助從業員的才能升級。" } ], "student_alumni_sharing": [ { "name": "Mr Dennis Hui", "title": "General Manager, Holiday Inn EXPRESS Hong Kong Kowloon CBD2", "program": "Graduate of Certificate in Hotel Management (offered by Caritas Francis Hsu College)", "sharing": "Beside operations and management knowledge, the Hotel course provided by Caritas also encouraged me to learn during the training in different departments of the hotel." }, { "name": "Mr Ken Wong", "title": "Fund Accountant, HSBC", "program": "Graduate of BBA (Hons) Accountancy", "sharing": "Graduation season was closed. Whilst graduation is the closing of one chapter, it is the opening of a new one in my life. I want to say a big 'Thank You' to my professors at CIHE for their excellent teaching, caring and advice on my studies and career. I also acquired the accounting knowledge and skills which formed a firm basis for my current work as a fund accountant at HSBC. Sure, not only had I clearly learned a lot about accounting, my critical thinking and problem-solving skills had become drastically better to handle different difficult issues." }, { "name": "Ms Fong Man Sai", "title": null, "program": "Graduate of BBA (Hons) Corporate Management", "sharing": "You can never plan the future by the past. Edmund Burke. I was a social science student before I entered Caritas Institute of Higher Education. I thank my alma mater for accepting my shortcomings and giving me a chance to step into new fields. Teachers in Caritas Institute of Higher Education taught me according to my aptitude. My alma mater had a major influence in making me who I am today. Time flies. I have been working in the society for several years after my graduation. Although I still encounter difficulties in my career, I can overcome the difficulties as I have learnt patient, perseverance, continuous learning and never give up from my alma mater. Luckily, I become a chartered company secretary now. Trust me, you can make it too." }, { "name": "Ms Cherie Chen", "title": null, "program": "Graduate of BBA (Hons) Hotel Management", "sharing": "Learning is a continuous and lifelong process, students or practitioners should keep learning the latest developments and trends in their field. I studied Bachelor of Business Administration (Honours) Hotel Management in Caritas Institute of Higher Education (CIHE) which did give me a different campus life. In the past 4 years, t." }, { "name": "Mr Gavin Liang Jian Hua", "title": null, "program": null, "sharing": null }, { "name": "Mr Frank Hu Jiayuan", "title": null, "program": null, "sharing": null }, { "name": "Mr Sin Chun Tsuen", "title": null, "program": null, "sharing": null }, { "name": "Ms Ou Yamin", "title": null, "program": null, "sharing": null } ] } { "graduates": [ { "name": "Mr Gavin Liang Jian Hua", "programme": "BBA (Hons) (Marketing and Event Management Stream)", "testimonial": "The four years of study at Caritas were so valuable. I was glad of meeting a group of passionate teachers whose expertise and industrial experiences demonstrated what a professional means. I was so excited to earn a dream job of being a management trainee in a multinational retail conglomerate after graduation. I found my knowledge in marketing and event management very useful at work. I urge freshmen to seize the opportunity, be proactive in studying and participating in study-related events. These would become your treasure in life." }, { "name": "Mr Frank Hu Jiayuan", "programme": "BBA (Hons) (Hotel Management Stream)", "testimonial": "I'm Frank. A student from China who graduated from BBA (Hons) Hotel Management in 2019. I am very happy that I studied the hotel management at Caritas Institute of Higher Education (CIHE). I learnt a lot. Someone asked me \"What have you learned from the programme?\" I told them firmly: \"It is the way of thinking to solve problems.\" This is the most valuable thing the teachers of the Rita Tong Liu School of Business and Hospitality Management (SBHM) taught me. After graduated in 2019, I entered another stage of my life – working in Guangdong Hotel where located in Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong. Thanks to the teachers of SBHM who cultivated me into a thoughtful and understandable hotelier, which gave me the opportunity to learn and apply for it. The programme provided me with a solid foundation such as how to solve problems from different points of view. Teachers also taught me which method to solve problems in terms of professional and applicable. It gives strength for me to overcome my fears when working in the new environment. This also cultivates me to face the realistic world by reinforcing my knowledges. Thus, it enhances my self-worth by solving various problems in the workplace. Students who do not have hotel work experience can choose the front desk as the starting point of their career journey. This position plays more roles and functions than we imagined. Then, you should know my first job was a receptionist in the hotel. If you think that the front desk can only help guests to check in and out, it is quite a misunderstanding. Helping guests check-in and check-out would be just the most basic task. The front desk is not only a facade of the hotel, but also an important bridge between the hotel and the guests. It is also a seasoning between the internal departments of the hotel. A qualified staff must handle and coordinate both internal and external relations, so that all hotel departments can be connected together to provide consumers with high-quality services. When it comes to the service industry, many people have different opinions. The general environment is not an excuse. As long as students have confidence in themselves and the School, they can build a better future. Believe in yourself, come on, we are all candidates, I wish you all a happy journey in life!" }, { "name": "Mr Sin Chun Tsuen", "programme": "BBA (Hons) (Hotel Management Stream)", "testimonial": "Caritas Institute of Higher Education (CIHE) provides ample support for their students, especially in helping them to prepare for their future career. Teachers are willing to provide suggestions related to the real working environment. Apart from theoretical knowledge, teachers often share the current and future trends of the industry." } ] } { "student_preparation": "students can get well-prepared before joining the industry", "skills_learned": ["professional management skills and knowledge", "latest issues of the industry"], "competitive_advantage_training": "Students are given chance to think about how to keep competitive advantage while the external environment is always changing", "talent_development": "eventually showing their true talent", "practical_training_benefits": ["able to easily adapt the new working environment", "unleash my potentiality in my first internship"], "higher_education_success": "personal effort contributes to success", "teacher_support": "As long as students are willing to ask their teachers for advice, they can readily gain great success", "program_emphasis": "business education with a balanced emphasis on both theory and practices of business administration", "professor_qualities": ["profound knowledge", "sincere teaching attitude"], "learning_outcomes": ["learned useful knowledge", "laid the foundation for my future as a professional accountant"], "appreciation": "appreciate all professors for their passionate teaching", "covid_adaptation": "Although face-to-face teaching is not available due to the COVID-19 epidemic, they still show passion and care to all students" }

student_alumni_sharing.name: Lam Hoi Ying
student_alumni_sharing.testimonial: Five years ago, I was confused about my future pathway. Gratefully, Caritas Institute of Higher Education offers the course of nursing which allows me have a new target. In these years, I have grown up a lot and become more certain about my career pathways. Nursing is a dedicated professional which requires the accumulation of knowledge, skills and experiences. I have to say thank you to all the lecturers. Apart from the knowledge and skills they taught in class, they also shared their previous working experience with us. In the clinical practicum, they led us to take up the role of a nurse step by step. Without them, I would not have become an independent professional now.

remarks: The Principal's Nomination Scholarship (PNS) Scheme is for DSE graduates applied for BEdECE Full-time (Year 1 Entry) programme. The nomination has to be from secondary school principal. Successful awardees would receive a scholarship to cover their tuition fees. The tuition fee is HK$10,000 per annum. For further details, refer to 'Scholarships and Financial Assistance' section.
This programme has been recognized by the Education Brueau as an approved Programme for enrolling in Certificate in Kindergarten Principalship course.
Those who are holding CE(ECE), Child Care Worker (CCW) and Child Care Supervisor (CCS) Graduates are eligible to register as Special Child Care Worker (SCCW).

  "about_us": "Career Centre is the bridge between quality education and successful career for students in SFU and CBCC. Whether you’re looking for a new part-time or permanent job, or looking to enhance your CV or interview skills, we’ll help you get there!",
  "job_search": "Over 110 employer partners providing opportunities to students and graduates for internship, placements, summer jobs, part-time jobs and full-time graduate hire.",
  "events_and_activities": "We host a signature Career Fair every year and other activities including career talks with individual employers, company visits, speed-networking, sharing sessions, online info-day, online seminars with industry representatives, and many others. We also promote and host various career related competitions and outreach.",
  "career_training": {
    "description": "We provides four series of training to enhance career readiness, namely:",
    "series": [
      "Career Exploration – helping students find their career aspiration",
      "Employment Preparation – preparing for skills needed in job hunting",
      "The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People ® - enhancing general life skills through licensed corporate training",
      "Career Skills – equipping students with practical skillsets useful in the workplace"
    ]
  },
  "career_coaching": "Individual and small group coaching and career consultation are provided by experienced career advisors to tailor for students' and graduates' needs for employment.",
  "further_study_and_articulations": "Career and life planning approach in helping you plan your further study and articulations. Moving onto higher diploma, undergraduate and postgradute studies.",
  "career_handbook": "The Career Handbook 2024 provides a detailed introduction to the services and application procedures offered by the Career Centre. It also includes the 2024-2025 schedule for students."
}

structured_data.about_us: Career Centre is the bridge between quality education and successful career for students in SFU and CBCC. Whether you’re looking for a new part-time or permanent job, or looking to enhance your CV or interview skills, we’ll help you get there!

We also promote and host various career related competitions and outreach.

documents.content: { "Career Training": { "Career Exploration": { "Personality Dimensions®": "An easily understood method for building self-awareness, self-esteem and effective communication strategies. It uses the self-discovery method to select the temperament that is most like you, and helps to determine your preferred work style, work environment, strengths, challenges, and career fit.", "Career Dimensions™": "This workshop focuses on exploring your work preferences. Unlike many career assessment instruments, Career Dimensions™ helps you to explore the actual work environment in which you are most comfortable by examining a variety of areas, including the natural talents you bring to work, your values, your major job stressors, your work philosophy and your definition of success.", "Build Your Career Plan": "A self-exploring activity designed to find students' career path. With instructions and guidance, students are expected to determine their short-term and long-term career goals, making detailed action plans." }, "Employment Preparation": { "Resume and Job Search Workshop": "Aims at facilitating students to learn the structure and techniques to create an effective resume and how to target their resumes to specific jobs. How to create a presentable cover letter and how to look for job opportunities are also the main points in the workshop. Students are required to complete and submit their resumes for Career Advisors review.", "Interview Workshop": "Aims to comprehensively prepare students for job interviews. Participants will strengthen their knowledge of different interview formats, enhance techniques to effectively navigate the process, and improve confidence and first impressions. Mock interviews are conducted in the workshop, and Career Advisors will provide immediate feedback." }, "The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People®": { "Description": "Based on the proven principles found in Dr. Stephen R. Covey's best-selling business book, The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People® workshop helps to achieve sustained superior results by focusing on making individuals more effective. documents.content:
{
  "name": "LI Chengze",
  "title": "Dr",
  "address": "Room A806",
  "telephone": "3702 4221",
  "email": "czli@sfu.edu.hk",
  "school": "School of Computing and Information Sciences",
  "research_interest": "2D Non-photorealistic Graphics, Computational Photography, Image and Video Processing, and HCI",
  "biography": "My name is Chengze Li, and I currently work as an Assistant Professor in the School of Computing and Information Sciences at Caritas Institute of Higher Education. I received my B.Eng. degree from University of Science and Technology of China in 2013, and Ph.D. degree from Department of Computer Science and Engineering, the Chinese University of Hong Kong in 2020. In recent years, my research focuses on the understanding and processing of 2D non-photorealistic contents with deep learning techniques. Especially, I wrote several papers on the processing of ACG (animation, comics, games) contents and some of them are accepted by top venues such as ACM SIGGRAPH. I am also interested in some other computer vision and graphics topics, such as computational photography, deep image semantic understanding, visualization, and human-computer interaction. I write production codes for my research projects, and some of them are available on the internet. Besides, I also know some frontend programming—one of my favourite works is the frontend design of the USTC Open Source Mirror.",
  "teaching": "Before I joined CIHE, I worked as course tutors and was responsible for the tutorial sessions, course practices, homework, and examinations of multiple courses in CUHK, including: Introduction to Engineering Design (CSE fundamentals), Computer Principles and Java Programming (CSE Fundamentals, outstanding TA award), Introduction to Multimedia Systems, Building Web Applications, Design & Analysis of Algorithm, Network and Web Programming (PG Course), GPU Programming (PG Course). I also worked as an (Acting) Postdoctoral Fellow in the CUHK Jockey Club AI for the Future Project, which aims at promoting AI education to middle school students and teachers. In this project, I was responsible for the course design of AI curriculums. I also designed a set of corresponding AI laboratory sessions and materials in software and hardware platforms for the project.",
  "research": "My research interests include 2D non-photorealistic graphics, computational photography, image and video processing, and HCI. In recent years, I worked together with my colleges and the ACG (2-dimensional media) community to research real-life challenges in the production of comics, illustrations, and animations. Meanwhile, we also developed various applications towards user-friendly and efficient processing in the comics and animation pipeline to save the production cost. I am currently a professional member of ACM. I also help with peer-reviewing in several conference events and journals, including ACM SIGGRAPH, IEEE TVCG, IEEE TPAMI, etc.",

structured_data.name: LI Chengze
structured_data.title: Dr
structured_data.school: School of Computing and Information Sciences
structured_data.research_interest: 2D Non-photorealistic Graphics, Computational Photography, Image and Video Processing, and HCI
structured_data.biography: My name is Chengze Li, and I currently work as an Assistant Professor in the School of Computing and Information Sciences at Caritas Institute of Higher Education. I received my B.Eng. degree from University of Science and Technology of China in 2013, and Ph.D. degree from Department of Computer Science and Engineering, the Chinese University of Hong Kong in 2020. In recent years, my research focuses on the understanding and processing of 2D non-photorealistic contents with deep learning techniques. Especially, I wrote several papers on the processing of ACG (animation, comics, games) contents and some of them are accepted by top venues such as ACM SIGGRAPH. I am also interested in some other computer vision and graphics topics, such as computational photography, deep image semantic understanding, visualization, and human-computer interaction. I write production codes for my research projects, and some of them are available on the internet. Besides, I also know some frontend programming—one of my favourite works is the frontend design of the USTC Open Source Mirror.
structured_data.teaching: Before I joined CIHE, I worked as course tutors and was responsible for the tutorial sessions, course practices, homework, and examinations of multiple courses in CUHK, including: Introduction to Engineering Design (CSE fundamentals), Computer Principles and Java Programming (CSE Fundamentals, outstanding TA award), Introduction to Multimedia Systems, Building Web Applications, Design & Analysis of Algorithm, Network and Web Programming (PG Course), GPU Programming (PG Course). I also worked as an (Acting) Postdoctoral Fellow in the CUHK Jockey Club AI for the Future Project, which aims at promoting AI education to middle school students and teachers. In this project, I was responsible for the course design of AI curriculums. I also designed a set of corresponding AI laboratory sessions and materials in software and hardware platforms for the project.
structured_data.research: My research interests include 2D non-photorealistic graphics, computational photography, image and video processing, and HCI. In recent years, I worked together with my colleges and the ACG (2-dimensional media) community to research real-life challenges in the production of comics, illustrations, and animations. Meanwhile, we also developed various applications towards user-friendly and efficient processing in the comics and animation pipeline to save the production cost. I am currently a professional member of ACM. I also help with peer-reviewing in several conference events and journals, including ACM SIGGRAPH, IEEE TVCG, IEEE TPAMI, etc.

outstanding and deserving Catholic students from Southeast Asian countries in achieving their educational goals at SFU", "objectives": [ "Empower Catholic youth from Southeast Asia to achieve upward social and economic mobility while enhancing their prospects for future career advancement", "Provide Southeast Asian Catholic youth with the opportunity to pursue academic studies at SFU in Hong Kong, free from financial constraints", "Attract and cultivate young talent from Southeast Asia by enrolling them in the innovative 'Techno-Humanities Business Cluster', which integrates information technology, humanities, social sciences, and business to address emerging global challenges", "Equip students with cutting-edge knowledge, advanced job skills, and the ability to improve operational efficiency across diverse industries in response to evolving market and technological advancements", "Foster a dynamic and inclusive learning environment by promoting intercultural dialogue and collaboration between local and international students, thereby enriching the global academic community at SFU" ], "programmes": [ "Bachelor of Arts (Honours) in Language and Culture", "Bachelor of Entertainment Technology", "Bachelor of Social Sciences (Honours) in Social Care", "Bachelor of Social Sciences (Honours) in Psychology" ], "scholarship_coverage": "fully cover the tuition fees for the aforementioned bachelor's degree programme", "additional_opportunities": "engage in on-campus placements within various SFU departments and administrative offices", "eligibility_criteria": [ "Be a
